text: Elizabeth ’s impatience to acquaint Jane with what had happened could no longer be overcome ; and at length resolving to suppress every particular in which her sister was concerned , and preparing her to be surprised , she related to her the next morning the chief of the scene between Mr. Darcy and herself . Miss Bennet ’s astonishment was soon lessened by the strong sisterly partiality which made any admiration of Elizabeth appear perfectly natural ; and all surprise was shortly lost in other feelings .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth ’s impatience to acquaint Jane with what had happened could no longer be overcome ; and at length resolving to suppress every particular in which her sister was concerned , and preparing her to be surprised , she related to her the next morning the chief of the scene between Mr. Darcy and herself . Miss Bennet ’s astonishment was soon lessened by the strong sisterly partiality which made any admiration of Elizabeth appear perfectly natural ; and all surprise was shortly lost in other feelings .

text: She was sorry that Mr. Darcy should have delivered his sentiments in a manner so little suited to recommend them ; but still more was she grieved for the unhappiness which her sister ’s refusal must have given him .

text: “ His being so sure of succeeding was wrong , ” said she , “ and certainly ought not to have appeared ; but consider how much it must increase his disappointment . ”

text: “ Indeed , ” replied Elizabeth , “ I am heartily sorry for him ; but he has other feelings which will probably soon drive away his regard for me .

text: Having never even fancied herself in love before , her regard had all the warmth of first attachment , and from her age and disposition , greater steadiness than first attachments often boast ; and so fervently did she value his remembrance , and prefer him to every other man , that all her good sense , and all her attention to the feelings of her friends , were requisite to check the indulgence of those regrets which must have been injurious to her own health and their tranquillity . “ Well , Lizzy , ” said Mrs. Bennet , one day , “ what is your opinion _ now _ of this sad business of Jane ’s ?

text: Wholly inattentive to her sister ’s feelings , Lydia flew about the house in restless ecstasy , calling for everyone ’s congratulations , and laughing and talking with more violence than ever ; whilst the luckless Kitty continued in the parlour repining at her fate in terms as unreasonable as her accent was peevish . “ I can not see why Mrs. Forster should not ask _ me _ as well as Lydia , ” said she , “ though I am _ not _ her particular friend .
text_tokenized: Wholly inattentive to her sister ’s feelings , Lydia flew about the house in restless ecstasy , calling for everyone ’s congratulations , and laughing and talking with more violence than ever ; whilst the luckless Kitty continued in the parlour repining at her fate in terms as unreasonable as her accent was peevish . “ I can not see why Mrs. Forster should not ask _ me _ as well as Lydia , ” said she , “ though I am _ not _ her particular friend .

text: As for Elizabeth herself , this invitation was so far from exciting in her the same feelings as in her mother and Lydia , that she considered it as the death - warrant of all possibility of common sense for the latter ; and detestable as such a step must make her , were it known , she could not help secretly advising her father not to let her go .
text_tokenized: As for Elizabeth herself , this invitation was so far from exciting in her the same feelings as in her mother and Lydia , that she considered it as the death - warrant of all possibility of common sense for the latter ; and detestable as such a step must make her , were it known , she could not help secretly advising her father not to let her go .

text: She represented to him all the improprieties of Lydia ’s general behaviour , the little advantage she could derive from the friendship of such a woman as Mrs. Forster , and the probability of her being yet more imprudent with such a companion at Brighton , where the temptations must be greater than at home .

text: He heard her attentively , and then said,-- “ Lydia will never be easy till she has exposed herself in some public place or other , and we can never expect her to do it with so little expense or inconvenience to her family as under the present circumstances . ”

text: “ If you were aware , ” said Elizabeth , “ of the very great disadvantage to us all , which must arise from the public notice of Lydia ’s unguarded and imprudent manner , nay , which has already arisen from it , I am sure you would judge differently in the affair . ” “ Already arisen ! ” repeated Mr. Bennet .

text: If you , my dear father , will not take the trouble of checking her exuberant spirits , and of teaching her that her present pursuits are not to be the business of her life , she will soon be beyond the reach of amendment .
text_tokenized: If you , my dear father , will not take the trouble of checking her exuberant spirits , and of teaching her that her present pursuits are not to be the business of her life , she will soon be beyond the reach of amendment .

text: Her character will be fixed ; and she will , at sixteen , be the most determined flirt that ever made herself and her family ridiculous;--a flirt , too , in the worst and meanest degree of flirtation ; without any attraction beyond youth and a tolerable person ; and , from the ignorance and emptiness of her mind , wholly unable to ward off any portion of that universal contempt which her rage for admiration will excite .

text: In this danger Kitty is also comprehended .
text_tokenized: In this danger Kitty is also comprehended .

text: She will follow wherever Lydia leads .
text_tokenized: She will follow wherever Lydia leads .

text: Vain , ignorant , idle , and absolutely uncontrolled !
text_tokenized: Vain , ignorant , idle , and absolutely uncontrolled !

text: Oh , my dear father , can you suppose it possible that they will not be censured and despised wherever they are known , and that their sisters will not be often involved in the disgrace ?
text_tokenized: Oh , my dear father , can you suppose it possible that they will not be censured and despised wherever they are known , and that their sisters will not be often involved in the disgrace ?

text: ” Mr. Bennet saw that her whole heart was in the subject ; and , affectionately taking her hand , said , in reply,-- “ Do not make yourself uneasy , my love .
text_tokenized: ” Mr. Bennet saw that her whole heart was in the subject ; and , affectionately taking her hand , said , in reply,-- “ Do not make yourself uneasy , my love .

text: Wherever you and Jane are known , you must be respected and valued ; and you will not appear to less advantage for having a couple of -- or I may say , three -- very silly sisters .
text_tokenized: Wherever you and Jane are known , you must be respected and valued ; and you will not appear to less advantage for having a couple of -- or I may say , three -- very silly sisters .

text: We shall have no peace at Longbourn if Lydia does not go to Brighton .
text_tokenized: We shall have no peace at Longbourn if Lydia does not go to Brighton .

text: Let her go , then .
text_tokenized: Let her go , then .

text: Colonel Forster is a sensible man , and will keep her out of any real mischief ; and she is luckily too poor to be an object of prey to anybody .
text_tokenized: Colonel Forster is a sensible man , and will keep her out of any real mischief ; and she is luckily too poor to be an object of prey to anybody .

text: At Brighton she will be of less importance even as a common flirt than she has been here .
text_tokenized: At Brighton she will be of less importance even as a common flirt than she has been here .

text: The officers will find women better worth their notice .
text_tokenized: The officers will find women better worth their notice .

text: Let us hope , therefore , that her being there may teach her her own insignificance .
text_tokenized: Let us hope , therefore , that her being there may teach her her own insignificance .

text: At any rate , she can not grow many degrees worse , without authorizing us to lock her up for the rest of her life . ” With this answer Elizabeth was forced to be content ; but her own opinion continued the same , and she left him disappointed and sorry .
text_tokenized: At any rate , she can not grow many degrees worse , without authorizing us to lock her up for the rest of her life . ” With this answer Elizabeth was forced to be content ; but her own opinion continued the same , and she left him disappointed and sorry .

text: It was not in her nature , however , to increase her vexations by dwelling on them .
text_tokenized: It was not in her nature , however , to increase her vexations by dwelling on them .

text: She was confident of having performed her duty ; and to fret over unavoidable evils , or augment them by anxiety , was no part of her disposition .
text_tokenized: She was confident of having performed her duty ; and to fret over unavoidable evils , or augment them by anxiety , was no part of her disposition .

text: Had Lydia and her mother known the substance of her conference with her father , their indignation would hardly have found expression in their united volubility .
text_tokenized: Had Lydia and her mother known the substance of her conference with her father , their indignation would hardly have found expression in their united volubility .

text: In Lydia ’s imagination , a visit to Brighton comprised every possibility of earthly happiness .
text_tokenized: In Lydia ’s imagination , a visit to Brighton comprised every possibility of earthly happiness .

text: She saw , with the creative eye of fancy , the streets of that gay bathing - place covered with officers .
text_tokenized: She saw , with the creative eye of fancy , the streets of that gay bathing - place covered with officers .

text: She saw herself the object of attention to tens and to scores of them at present unknown .
text_tokenized: She saw herself the object of attention to tens and to scores of them at present unknown .

text: She saw all the glories of the camp : its tents stretched forth in beauteous uniformity of lines , crowded with the young and the gay , and dazzling with scarlet ; and , to complete the view , she saw herself seated beneath a tent , tenderly flirting with at least six officers at once .

text: Had she known that her sister sought to tear her from such prospects and such realities as these , what would have been her sensations ?

text: have been understood only by her mother , who might have felt nearly the same .

text: Lydia ’s going to Brighton was all that consoled her for the melancholy conviction of her husband ’s never intending to go there himself .
text_tokenized: Lydia ’s going to Brighton was all that consoled her for the melancholy conviction of her husband ’s never intending to go there himself .

text: But they were entirely ignorant of what had passed ; and their raptures continued , with little intermission , to the very day of Lydia ’s leaving home .
text_tokenized: But they were entirely ignorant of what had passed ; and their raptures continued , with little intermission , to the very day of Lydia ’s leaving home .

text: Elizabeth was now to see Mr. Wickham for the last time .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was now to see Mr. Wickham for the last time .

text: Having been frequently in company with him since her return , agitation was pretty well over ; the agitations of former partiality entirely so .
text_tokenized: Having been frequently in company with him since her return , agitation was pretty well over ; the agitations of former partiality entirely so .

text: She had even learnt to detect , in the very gentleness which had first delighted her , an affectation and a sameness to disgust and weary .

text_tokenized: In his present behaviour to herself

text: , moreover , she had a fresh source of displeasure ; for the inclination he soon testified of renewing those attentions which had marked the early part of their acquaintance could only serve , after what had since passed , to provoke her .
text_tokenized: , moreover , she had a fresh source of displeasure ; for the inclination he soon testified of renewing those attentions which had marked the early part of their acquaintance could only serve , after what had since passed , to provoke her .

text: She lost all concern for him in finding herself thus selected as the object of such idle and frivolous gallantry ; and while she steadily repressed it , could not but feel the reproof contained in his believing , that however long , and for whatever cause , his attentions had been withdrawn , her vanity would be gratified , and her preference secured , at any time , by their renewal . On the very last day of the regiment ’s remaining in Meryton , he dined , with others of the officers , at Longbourn ; and so little was Elizabeth disposed to part from him in good - humour , that , on his making some inquiry as to the manner in which her time had passed at Hunsford , she mentioned Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s and Mr. Darcy ’s having both spent three weeks at Rosings , and asked him if he were acquainted with the former .
text_tokenized: She lost all concern for him in finding herself thus selected as the object of such idle and frivolous gallantry ; and while she steadily repressed it , could not but feel the reproof contained in his believing , that however long , and for whatever cause , his attentions had been withdrawn , her vanity would be gratified , and her preference secured , at any time , by their renewal . On the very last day of the regiment ’s remaining in Meryton , he dined , with others of the officers , at Longbourn ; and so little was Elizabeth disposed to part from him in good - humour , that , on his making some inquiry as to the manner in which her time had passed at Hunsford , she mentioned Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s and Mr. Darcy ’s having both spent three weeks at Rosings , and asked him if he were acquainted with the former .

text: He looked surprised , displeased , alarmed ; but , with a moment ’s recollection , and a returning smile , replied , that he had formerly seen him often ; and , after observing that he was a very gentlemanlike man , asked her how she had liked him .
text_tokenized: He looked surprised , displeased , alarmed ; but , with a moment ’s recollection , and a returning smile , replied , that he had formerly seen him often ; and , after observing that he was a very gentlemanlike man , asked her how she had liked him .

text: Her answer was warmly in his favour .
text_tokenized: Her answer was warmly in his favour .

text: With an air of indifference , he soon afterwards added , “ How long did you say that he was at Rosings ? ” “ Nearly three weeks . ” “ And you saw him frequently ? ” “ Yes , almost every day . ” “ His manners are very different from his cousin ’s . ”
text_tokenized: With an air of indifference , he soon afterwards added , “ How long did you say that he was at Rosings ? ” “ Nearly three weeks . ” “ And you saw him frequently ? ” “ Yes , almost every day . ” “ His manners are very different from his cousin ’s . ”

text: “ Yes , very different ; but I think Mr. Darcy improves on acquaintance . ” “ Indeed ! ” cried Wickham , with a look which did not escape her .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , very different ; but I think Mr. Darcy improves on acquaintance . ” “ Indeed ! ” cried Wickham , with a look which did not escape her .

text: “ And pray may I ask-- ” but checking himself , he added , in a gayer tone , “ Is it in address that he improves ?
text_tokenized: “ And pray may I ask-- ” but checking himself , he added , in a gayer tone , “ Is it in address that he improves ?

text: Has he deigned to add aught of civility to his ordinary style ?
text_tokenized: Has he deigned to add aught of civility to his ordinary style ?

text: for I dare not hope , ” he continued , in a lower and more serious tone , “ that he is improved in essentials . ”
text_tokenized: for I dare not hope , ” he continued , in a lower and more serious tone , “ that he is improved in essentials . ”

text: “ Oh , no ! ” said Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ Oh , no ! ” said Elizabeth .

text: “ In essentials , I believe , he is very much what he ever was . ”
text_tokenized: “ In essentials , I believe , he is very much what he ever was . ”

text: While she spoke , Wickham looked as if scarcely knowing whether to rejoice over her words or to distrust their meaning .
text_tokenized: While she spoke , Wickham looked as if scarcely knowing whether to rejoice over her words or to distrust their meaning .

text: There was a something in her countenance which made him listen with an apprehensive and anxious attention , while she added,-- “ When I said that he improved on acquaintance , I did not mean that either his mind or manners were in a state of improvement ; but that , from knowing him better , his disposition was better understood .

text: ” Wickham ’s alarm now appeared in a heightened complexion and agitated look ; for a few minutes he was silent ; till , shaking off his embarrassment , he turned to her again , and said in the gentlest of accents,-- “ You , who so well know my feelings towards Mr. Darcy , will readily comprehend how sincerely I must rejoice that he is wise enough to assume even the _ appearance _ of what is right .

text: The rest of the evening passed with the _ appearance _ , on his side , of usual cheerfulness , but with no further attempt to distinguish Elizabeth ; and they parted at last with mutual civility , and possibly a mutual desire of never meeting again . When the party broke up , Lydia returned with Mrs. Forster to Meryton , from whence they were to set out early the next morning .

text: The separation between her and her family was rather noisy than pathetic .
text_tokenized: The separation between her and her family was rather noisy than pathetic .

text: Kitty was the only one who shed tears ; but she did weep from vexation and envy .
text_tokenized: Kitty was the only one who shed tears ; but she did weep from vexation and envy .

text: Mrs. Bennet was diffuse in her good wishes for the felicity of her daughter , and impressive in her injunctions that she would not miss the opportunity of enjoying herself as much as possible,--advice which there was every reason to believe would be attended to ; and , in the clamorous happiness of Lydia herself in bidding farewell , the more gentle adieus of her sisters were uttered without being heard .
